i2s_audio.docs:
The `i2s_audio` microphone platform allows you to receive audio via the the [I²S Audio Component](https://esphome.io/components/i2s_audio.html).

*See also: [I²S Audio Microphone](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/i2s_audio.html#i2s-audio-microphone)*

on_data.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when new data is received.

*See also: [Microphone Components](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/index.html#base-microphone-configuration)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The microphone to check. Defaults to the only one in YAML.

*See also: [microphone.on_data Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/index.html#microphone-on-data-trigger)*

capture.docs:
This action will start capturing audio data from the microphone. The data will be passed to any components listening and will be available in the `on_data` trigger.

*See also: [`microphone.capture` Action](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/index.html#microphone-capture-action)*

stop_capture.docs:
This action will stop capturing audio data from the microphone.

*See also: [`microphone.stop_capture` Action](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/index.html#microphone-stop-capture-action)*

is_capturing.docs:
This condition will check if the microphone is currently capturing audio data.

*See also: [`microphone.is_capturing` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/microphone/index.html#microphone-is-capturing-condition)*
